name: Check box
htmlBanner:
Checkbox

Checkboxes allow users to select multiple options from a list or turn an item/feature on or off. Checkboxes are often used in forms, settings, and selections in lists.

Accessibility.html:
Overview

Some users may rely on assistive technologies, such as keyboard navigations, screen readers or voice commands, to navigate and use websites or applications. Therefore, it is important to make sure that the checkbox is properly labeled, has a clear and concise description of its function, and meets minimum color contrast, so that users with visual or cognitive impairments can understand its purpose.

Color Contrast

Checkbox text smaller than 18pt or 14pt bold must have a color contrast ratio of at least 4.5:1 with its background. Note: Disabled states do not need to meet a color contrast minimum. Checkbox Group Labels Checkbox Item Labels Larger font sizes must have a color contrast ratio of at least 3:1. Parts of graphics required to understand the content must have a color contrast ratio of at least 3:1. WCAG References‚Ä®1.4.3: Contrast (Minimum) (Level AA)‚Ä®1.4.11: Non-text Contrast (Level AA)

Interaction

For users with motor impairments, such as tremors or limited mobility, it may be difficult to accurately click or select checkboxes. To address this, designers can make checkboxes‚Äô clickable areas easier to target, and provide alternative input methods such as keyboard shortcuts. WCAG References‚Ä®2.2.2: Keyboard (Level A)‚Ä®2.4.3 Focus Order (Level A)

Pointer Gesture

Users can select checkboxes by clicking the checkbox or the label.

Keyboard Interactions

All interactive elements must be operable using only a keyboard. Focus order should also be logical. Note: For checkboxes with info buttons, tabbing order should move focus through this order: checkbox > info button > next checkbox Users can select checkboxes by clicking the checkbox or the label.

Example: Parent Checkbox Group

Indeterminate

When an Indeterminate parent checkbox is activated, the parent checkbox will be selected and all child checkboxes will also be selected.

Selected

When a selected parent checkbox is inactivated, the parent checkbox will be unselected and all child checkboxes will also be unselected.

Unselected

When an unselected parent checkbox is activated, the child checkboxes will revert to either their previous state when the parent checkbox was last activated or to their default state when the page was initially loaded.

Screen Reader

When checkboxes are implemented, the label likely will require additional context to be announced by the screen reader. Checkbox or checkbox group must inform a user of the Name (visible label OR screen reader text) , Role (checkbox), and State (checked/not checked/mixed.) The group label must only be announced when first navigating into the group. When navigating between selections in a group, the individual selections can be announced without the group label: ‚Äú, checkbox, unselected‚Äù. WCAG References‚Ä®1.3.1: Info and Relationships (Level A)‚Ä®4.1.2: Name, Role, Value (Level A)

Ex. 1 Focus entering a 2-state group, first item is unchecked.

‚Äú, grouop, list with X items, checkbox, not checked, to check press SPACEBAR‚Äù

Ex. 2 Focus moves to second item in the list AND item is already checked.

‚Äú, checkbox, checked, to clear checkmark press SPACEBAR"‚Ä®Note: the position on the list does not have to be announced each time. Only new information must be announced when focus moves from one selection to the next.

Ex. 3 Focus entering a nested group.

Ex. 4 When there is an info button available

Spec.html:
Anatomy

Layout

Size

There is only one size, Default. *Note: Height (24px) is default size, and depending on the design, width can change depending on checkbox label text length. Border Radius Checkbox box border radius: 2px

Spacing

Horizontal spacing in label row: 8px Vertical spacing between label row and help text: 2px

Spacing

Checkboxes under page header

All content no matter what it is should start 4px from the page header. Thereafter the spacing between headers or sub headers and it's related content might vary.

Checkboxes under header

Starting a radio or checkbox directly under a header is 8px spacing. This should also apply to drop downs and buttons but not body text

Vertical spacing between checkboxes without descriptions

Spacing between checkboxes should be 8px

Vertical spacing between checkboxes with descriptions

Spacing between checkboxes should be 8px

Nested checkboxes spacing

Left margins for nested checkboxes should be 24px. Child checkbox should be left aligned with parent checkbox label. Follow vertical guidelines above for spacing between checkboxes. Note: Same spacing guidance follows when checkboxes are used in combination with radio buttons.

Tokens

Color and type tokens listed for component elements for each type and states. Color tokens can be found in the ‚ÄúTheme Tokens - Common‚Äù library. Type tokens can be found in the ‚ÄúTokens - Type Application‚Äù Library.

Elements

Unselected States

*Focus ring: #64B4FA Color token Library

Selected States

*Focus ring: #64B4FA Color token Library

Indeterminate States

*Focus ring: #64B4FA Color token Library

Guideline.html:
Overview

Checkboxes allow users to select multiple options from a list or turn an item/feature on or off. Checkboxes are often used in forms, settings, and selections in lists.

Anatomy

Use Cases

Types

Example of the component.

Unselected

Use the Unselected type when checkbox is unchecked. Can be used as a parent or child checkbox when checkbox list is nested.

Selected

Use the Selected type when checkbox is checked. Can be used as a parent or child checkbox when checkbox list is nested.

Indeterminate

Use the Indeterminate type as a parent checkbox when nested child checkboxes are present. When indeterminate parent checkbox is used, child checkbox(es) can be either Unselected or Selected.

Do‚Äôs and Dont‚Äôs

Checkbox Text Wrap Alignment

DO let text wrap beneath the checkbox so the control and label are top aligned

DON‚ÄôT vertically center wrap text with the checkbox

Content

Casing

All elements in checkbox components (header, label, description) should use sentence case.

Checkbox Label

Use clear and concise labels for checkboxes. Be explicit about the results that will follow if the checkbox(s) is selected. Labels should always appear to the right of checkbox inputs.

Label Length

Checkbox labels should be fewer than 4 words. Keep labels short and use descriptions to add more information. Don't truncate checkbox label text.

Useable Examples

Settings - Messaging (Webex App WinOS)

Settings - Messaging (Webex App WinOS)

User Details (Control Hub)
